Scorecard package helpers

scorecard.Rmd

woebin_summary 

bins <- woebin(germancredit, y = "creditability")
#> [INFO] creating woe binning ...

binssummary <- woebin_summary(bins)

binssummary
#> # A tibble: 20 x 15
#>    variable  n_categories      iv       ks   hhi count_distr_max count_distr_min

woebin_ply_min

The woebin_ply_min function donâ€™t need a data frame argument.

variable <- head(germancredit$credit.amount, 6)

bin <- bins$credit.amount

bin
#>         variable         bin count count_distr neg pos   posprob         woe
#> 1: credit.amount [-Inf,1400)   267       0.267 185  82 0.3071161  0.03366128
#> 2: credit.amount [1400,1800)   105       0.105  87  18 0.1714286 -0.72823850
#> 3: credit.amount [1800,4000)   382       0.382 287  95 0.2486911 -0.25830746
#> 4: credit.amount [4000,9200)   196       0.196 120  76 0.3877551  0.39053946
#> 5: credit.amount [9200, Inf)    50       0.050  21  29 0.5800000  1.17007125
#>          bin_iv  total_iv breaks is_special_values
#> 1: 0.0003045545 0.1812204   1400             FALSE
#> 2: 0.0468153322 0.1812204   1800             FALSE
#> 3: 0.0241086966 0.1812204   4000             FALSE
#> 4: 0.0319870413 0.1812204   9200             FALSE
#> 5: 0.0780047502 0.1812204    Inf             FALSE

woebin_ply_min(variable, bin)
#> [1]  0.03366128  0.39053946 -0.25830746  0.39053946  0.39053946  0.39053946

woebin_ply_min(variable, bin, value = "posprob")
#> [1] 0.3071161 0.3877551 0.2486911 0.3877551 0.3877551 0.3877551

woebin_cor_iv 

datcor <- woebin_cor_iv(germancredit, bins)
#> [INFO] converting into woe values ...
#> Warning in stats::cor(x = x, y = y, use = use, method = method): the standard
#> deviation is zero
#> 
#> Correlation method: 'pearson'
#> Missing treated using: 'pairwise.complete.obs'

datcor
#> # A tibble: 400 x 7
#>    var1             var2                   r var1_iv var1_rank var2_iv var2_rank
#>    <fct>            <fct>              <dbl>   <dbl>     <int>   <dbl>     <int>
#>  1 status.of.exist~ status.of.exist~ NA        0.639         1  0.639          1
#>  2 status.of.exist~ credit.history    0.203    0.639         1  0.292          2
#>  3 status.of.exist~ duration.in.mon~  0.0985   0.639         1  0.283          3
#>  4 status.of.exist~ savings.account~  0.219    0.639         1  0.191          4
#>  5 status.of.exist~ credit.amount     0.0916   0.639         1  0.181          5
#>  6 status.of.exist~ purpose           0.133    0.639         1  0.153          6
#>  7 status.of.exist~ age.in.years      0.129    0.639         1  0.130          7
#>  8 status.of.exist~ property          0.0652   0.639         1  0.113          8
#>  9 status.of.exist~ present.employm~  0.119    0.639         1  0.0853         9
#> 10 status.of.exist~ housing           0.112    0.639         1  0.0833        10
#> # ... with 390 more rows

cor_limit <- 0.15

datcor %>%
  filter(var1 != var2) %>%
  mutate(
    cor_conflict = ifelse(abs(r) > cor_limit, TRUE, FALSE),
    variable_to_remove = ifelse(
      cor_conflict,
      ifelse(var1 > var2, var2, var1),
      NA
    )
  )
#> Warning in Ops.factor(var1, var2): '>' not meaningful for factors
#> # A tibble: 380 x 9
#>    var1        var2           r var1_iv var1_rank var2_iv var2_rank cor_conflict
#>    <fct>       <fct>      <dbl>   <dbl>     <int>   <dbl>     <int> <lgl>       
#>  1 status.of.~ credit.h~ 0.203    0.639         1  0.292          2 TRUE        
#>  2 status.of.~ duration~ 0.0985   0.639         1  0.283          3 FALSE       
#>  3 status.of.~ savings.~ 0.219    0.639         1  0.191          4 TRUE        
#>  4 status.of.~ credit.a~ 0.0916   0.639         1  0.181          5 FALSE       
#>  5 status.of.~ purpose   0.133    0.639         1  0.153          6 FALSE       
#>  6 status.of.~ age.in.y~ 0.129    0.639         1  0.130          7 FALSE       
#>  7 status.of.~ property  0.0652   0.639         1  0.113          8 FALSE       
#>  8 status.of.~ present.~ 0.119    0.639         1  0.0853         9 FALSE       
#>  9 status.of.~ housing   0.112    0.639         1  0.0833        10 FALSE       
#> 10 status.of.~ other.in~ 0.0489   0.639         1  0.0576        11 FALSE       
#> # ... with 370 more rows, and 1 more variable: variable_to_remove <lgl>
